channel.title: travel on Foodieglobetrotter
channel.description: Recent content in travel on Foodieglobetrotter

item.title: Exploring Stresa, Italy and the beautiful Borromean islands!
New country, new rules
item.description: Switzerland is like heaven, so beautiful you will wish to stay and enjoy every moment. In terms of where we are staying (canton Valais), I cannot begin to describe how happy we are.

item.title: Cretan Dreams
item.description: All my life I’ve said I would get married in Crete. I would lie in bed with my best friend talking about my wedding to an amazing man in a small church in the middle of nowhere.

item.title: 10 things I loved about living in Cork
item.description: We have been living in Cork for just over three years now and I have never openly talked about how I felt about living here.

item.title: 6 month passport "rule" really a problem?
item.description: This is a question that will only cross your mind if you’re about to travel and realize that you have 6 months or less left on your passport.

item.title: Escape to Santorini
item.description: Dear Santorini, you are like a woman who knows she has it all and the world is at her feet. Yet, we cant help but fall in love with you.

item.title: Kimolos, Greek island deserving of praise!
item.description: We only went to Kimolos because we were invited to one of Sar’s good friends wedding! We were so thankful to be invited, as that weekend ended up being a great one!

item.title: Vietnam opened my eyes
item.description: I feel like I did not do justice to our trip in Vietnam. It was the best one month of my life and I spent it with my best friends Jun and Jonas and a friend I met while travelling Cambodia, Lukas!

item.title: Love from South Korea-famous for Gangnam Style!
item.description: I have not visited either of the Korea’s yet but one of my close friends Luis, travels so much for work he decided that he will be sending me pictures from his travels to add to my love for food.

item.title: Weekend shenanigans
item.description: We spent Saturday in Killarney catching up with friends from my university. I was never very good with goodbyes despite the time spent apart, I always feel this little bit of sadness.
